curam.util.exception
Class InformationalManager

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.exception.InformationalManager

public class InformationalManager
extends java.lang.Object

Informational Manager class which will hold & manage all validation failures and informational messages for a transaction. This class is responsible for providing a convenient interface on the hierarchy of elements and their resultant behavior.

Method Detail

addInformationalMsg

public void addInformationalMsg(AppException appException,
                                java.lang.String fieldName,
                                InformationalElement.InformationalType validationLevel)
                         throws InformationalException
This method is used to add an informational to the list. The informational is also logged if the trace is set to at least trace_on.

Parameters:
appException - An exception that describes the informational.
fieldName - The field on which informational failed.
validationLevel - The kind of informational failure.
Throws:
InformationalException - If the informational message being added is a fatal error. At this stage no more processing can be performed so the exception is thrown.

addInformationalMsg

public void addInformationalMsg(LocalisableString localisableString,
                                java.lang.String fieldName,
                                InformationalElement.InformationalType validationLevel)
                         throws InformationalException
This method is used to add an informational to the list. The informational is also logged if the trace is set to at least trace_on.

Parameters:
localisableString - A localisable string describing the situation.
fieldName - The field on which informational failed.
validationLevel - The kind of informational failure.
Throws:
InformationalException - If the informational message being added is a fatal error. At this stage no more processing can be performed so the exception is thrown.

failOperation

public void failOperation()
                   throws InformationalException
Throws an InformationalException if a fatal error has occurred, an error has occurred, or a warning has occurred which has not been specified as accepted. Otherwise the method simply returns and execution is allowed to continue.

Throws:
InformationalException - If an error has occurred which should cause the operation to fail.

operationHasInformationals

public boolean operationHasInformationals()
Indicates if a informational has been added which should be reported. An informational is reported if
  • A fatal error has occurred.
  • An error has occurred.
  • A warning has occurred which has not been specified as accepted.

    A return value of true from this method indicates that a call to failOperation() will cause an exception to be thrown.

    Returns:
    True if an informational has been added which should be reported, False otherwise.
    See Also:
    InformationalManager.failOperation()

    • obtainInformationalAsException

    public InformationalException obtainInformationalAsException()
    Obtain the informational which has been built up so that it can be returned as an exception to the client in the default server locale. An informational is reported if
  • A fatal error has occurred.
  • An error has occurred.
  • A warning has occurred which has not been specified as accepted.

    Returns:
    The informational which has been built up, null otherwise.

    • obtainInformationalAsException

    public InformationalException obtainInformationalAsException(java.lang.String locale)
    Obtain the informational that has been built up so that it can be returned as an exception to the client in the specified String locale. An informational is reported if
  • A fatal error has occurred.
  • An error has occurred.
  • A warning has occurred which has not been specified as accepted.

    Parameters:
    locale - a specified Locale.
    Returns:
    The informational which has been built up, null otherwise.

    • obtainInformationalAsException

    public InformationalException obtainInformationalAsException(java.util.Locale locale)
    Obtain the informational that has been built up so that it can be returned as an exception to the client in the specified Locale. An informational is reported if
  • A fatal error has occurred.
  • An error has occurred.
  • A warning has occurred which has not been specified as accepted.

    Parameters:
    locale - a specified Locale.
    Returns:
    The informational which has been built up, null otherwise.

    • obtainInformationalAsString

    public java.lang.String[] obtainInformationalAsString()
    Obtain the informational that has been built up so that it can be returned as an informational string to the client. An informational is reported if
  • A fatal error has occurred.
  • An error has occurred.
  • A warning has occurred which has not been specified as accepted.

    Returns:
    The informational which has been built up, null otherwise.

    • getMessagesForField

    public java.util.LinkedList<InformationalElement> getMessagesForField(java.lang.String fieldName)
    Gets all of the informational messages for a given field.

    Parameters:
    fieldName - The name of the field whose informational messages are being requested.
    Returns:
    A list of all the validation failures that are associated with the specific field, including those that would be ignored. If no such failures occurred, an empty list is returned.

    acceptWarning

    public void acceptWarning(java.lang.String fieldName,
                          AppException acceptedException)
    Mark a warning as being acceptable (i.e. one that should not be reported).

    Parameters:
    fieldName - The field on which the warning is acceptable.
    acceptedException - The specific exception which is acceptable on that field.
